title: Support mounting xfs/ext2/ext3/ext4/etc. partitions / drives / loop files
body: I have a multi-boot laptop, and would like to mount my xfs / extn / etc. partitions and boot to linux only when needed.

comments.body: + 1. Need this support asap for using dd on WSL.
mounting loop devices is essential to working with a linux system.

Not only WSL, but Windows needs this too. Current state of custom fs'es on Windows is "everything experimental/we're not responsible for data loss". I bet that Windows users would use them if they become solid and stable.
If this would be implemented, we can even expand this even further. For example: we can boot Linux right from existing Ext4 partition.
please add loop device, required by Appimage
+1 as having fun developing software that uses loop back for development & to be able to mount file images.
+1 it would be very nice, please!!! add it
+1, I need that, please add this functionality ASAP.

absolutly needed. It's will help me for most trouble i get with wsl.
This is the MUST HAVE feature.
This would be a great feature!
Would someone from Microsoft be kind enough to tell us what the plan is for this feature? It would make my life much easier for developing android kernels and roms on windows.
